instructions.reason_for_call: You recently faced a financial issue and want to cancel or return all possible orders.  Well, except the boots that you really really love, but you are happy to exchange it for boots of the exact same size and material to get maximum money back, but only if they are cheaper than what you have paid. At the end of the day, you ask the agent how much money you will get back.
instructions.known_info: You are Amelia, and you have two emails: silva7872@example.com and amelia.silva7872@example.com. You live in Philadelphia, and you are a loyal customer.
instructions.task_instructions: You are now emotional and a bit stress out. You like to talk very tersely.

messages.content: Hi! How can I help you today?

I need to cancel or return all my orders except the boots I really love. For the boots, I want to exchange them for the same size and material but only if the new boots are cheaper than what I paid. Can you help me with this? Also, I want to know how much money I will get back in total.

message.content: I need to cancel or return all my orders except the boots I really love. For the boots, I want to exchange them for the same size and material but only if the new boots are cheaper than what I paid. Can you help me with this? Also, I want to know how much money I will get back in total.

messages.content:
{
  "message": "I can help — but first I need to authenticate you and get a few clarifications so I can look up your orders and list the actions and refunds for your confirmation.",
  "what_I_need_from_you": [
    "Please provide your email address (preferred) — or first name, last name, and zip code if you don't want to share email.",
    "Identify the boots you want to keep (the single item to exclude). Provide at least one of: order id (e.g. '#W0000000'), item id (e.g. '1008292230'), or a short description plus approximate order date so I can find it.",
    "Confirm how you want refunds handled for cancellations/returns/exchange differences: (A) refund to the original payment method, or (B) refund to an existing gift card on your account. If (B), tell me which gift card id to use or say 'use default gift card'.",
    "If you want exchanges for the boots, confirm you want me to proceed only if the replacement boot item is cheaper than what you paid (you already stated this) — and confirm which payment method should be used if the exchange results in you owing money (credit card, PayPal, or gift card)."
  ],
  "notes_about_process": [
    "I must locate your user id by email or name+zip before doing anything. I will then list all orders and indicate which can be cancelled (status 'pending') or returned/exchanged (status 'delivered').",
    "I will not change or cancel anything until I present the exact action details (order ids, items, and refund amounts) and you explicitly confirm with 'yes'.",
    "Cancellations only work for 'pending' orders and require a cancellation reason ('no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake').",
    "Returns/exchanges only work for 'delivered' orders. Exchanges require specifying the new item ids (same product type). If the new boots are cheaper, you'll receive the difference; if more expensive, you'll need to pay the difference using the payment method you specify.",
    "I can only handle one user in this conversation. If you want to proceed, please provide your email (or name+zip) and the boots identifier and refund/payment preferences above."
  ]
}

  ]
}

messages.content:
My email is amelia.silva7872@example.com. The boots I want to keep are from order #W1234567, item id 1008292230, ordered around last month. 

For refunds, please refund to the original payment method. 

Yes, proceed with the exchange only if the replacement boots are cheaper than what I paid. If I owe money for the exchange, charge it to my credit card.
